name: Sean Carroll
tagline: Physicist exploring cosmology, quantum mechanics, and the nature of reality
bio:
Sean Carroll is a theoretical physicist whose work spans cosmology, quantum mechanics, and the foundations of physics. He's rare among physicists for his ability to communicate cutting-edge research to general audiences without dumbing it down—he respects both the complexity of the science and the intelligence of his readers.

Carroll's research focuses on fundamental questions: What is spacetime? How does time work? What is the universe made of? He's contributed to understanding dark energy, entropy, and the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics. Beyond technical research, he thinks deeply about what physics tells us about philosophy, consciousness, and meaning.

He hosts the Mindscape podcast where he interviews scientists, philosophers, and thinkers across disciplines, always probing foundational questions. Carroll represents a kind of public intellectual physicists—comfortable with speculation while grounded in rigorous science.

perspective.stance: The laws of physics are our best guide to understanding reality; many seemingly deep philosophical questions may have scientific answers
